alert.note: Alert for Western Skagit County (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued December 22 at 7:30PM PST until December 23 at 10:00PM PST by NWS Seattle
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 10 PM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mixed precipitation expected. Total snow accumulations of up to two inches and ice accumulations of up to one tenth of an inch. * WHERE...Lowlands of western Skagit County, including Cypress Island, Guemes Island, Anacortes, Mount Vernon, and La Conner. * WHEN...Until 10 PM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Hazardous travel conditions due to freezing rain and ice. Freezing rain and wind could result in tree damage and power outages. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Precipitation likely to begin as snow before transitioning to sleet and freezing rain before finally becoming all rain. Very difficult travel conditions are possible overnight through at least Friday morning. Avoid travel if possible.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. For the latest road conditions in Washington state, call 5 1 1.
